ai-iti89:1.1_0: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti89:2.1_0: “Mendicants, he is overcome by and immersed in three bad qualities, Devadatta is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.
ai-iti89:2.5_0: When there is still more to be done, stopping half-way after achieving some insignificant distinction.
ai-iti89:2.6_0: Overcome and overwhelmed by these three things that oppose the true teaching, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.”
ai-iti89:2.7_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-iti89:3.3_0: In this way you may know
ai-iti89:3.4_0: the place where those of wicked desires go.
ai-iti89:4.3_0: his glory stood forth like a flame,
ai-iti89:5.3_0: He’s gone to the Avīci hell,
ai-iti89:6.1_0: If you hurt one free from anger,
ai-iti89:6.4_0: with corrupt heart, lacking regard for others.
ai-iti89:7.2_0: the ocean with a pot of poison,
ai-iti89:7.3_0: But you would not be able to do so,
ai-iti89:7.4_0: for the sea is terribly large.
ai-iti89:9.1_0: The astute would befriend one like this,
ai-iti89:9.3_0: A mendicant who walks the path
ai-iti89:9.4_0: may attain the ending of suffering.”
ai-iti89:10.1_0: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti89:10.3_0: The fourth sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
